rationale: [Limit/Pullback Entry] The debate reveals a strong bullish consensus tempered by short-term cautions, aligning with lessons from past XAUUSD trades: the successful BUY emphasized trend strength (price above SMAs, bullish MACD) overriding overbought signals, while the failed SELL over-relied on isolated oscillators without confirmation. Here, Risky's points dominate—multi-timeframe BOS, price 12.5%+ above 50 SMA/22%+ above 200 SMA, neutral RSI (56.98 vs. gold's 78), unmitigated FVGs/OBs to 125-130, structural fundamentals (700Moz deficit, solar +158%, gold-silver ratio 73-95x), and bullish sentiment (75-90%, IG 69% long as squeeze fuel)—echoing the gold win's momentum capture via phased entries. Safe's MACD crossover/ADX 18.4 and USD/China concerns are valid short-term noise (per technical report: immature trend fills lower FVGs first), but isolated like gold's unconfirmed RSI; Neutral refines scaling wisely. Counter: No support break or -DI crossover yet; BOS overrides per SMC. Refine trader's plan per analysts/gold lessons: enter 20-30% now (Neutral/Risky blend, avoid Safe's full HOLD), scale 40% at 111.59 FVG hold/30% at 109.34 confirmation, SL tightened beyond 1H FVG at 109.00 (-7.4%, 2.5x ATR, avoids stop hunts), TP1 125 (50% out, BB extension +6.3%), TP2 130/trail remainder (FVG projections, 1:2+ R:R overall). Reduced size (3-4% portfolio max) for vol/news sensitivity (DXY>106, Fed/China alerts), ensuring sustainability over Risky's aggression or Safe's paralysis.
